tl966.question: TCAS: GO AROUND procedure must be performed when RA ____ or ____ is triggered on final approach.

options.text: CLIMB / INCREASE CLIMB
LEVEL OFF / MONITOR VERTICAL SPEED
CLIMB / DESCENT
MAINTAIN VERTICAL SPEED / MONITOR VERTICAL SPEED

a6k4b.question: If both FMGCs fail, the flight crew can use the RMPs (Radio Management Panels 1 and 2) on the pedestal for back up tuning. The CAPT RMP controls VOR 1, ADF 1 and ILS 1 & the F/O RMP controls VOR 2 and ILS 2.

n1qz.question: The TCAS system includes: (more than one answer is correct)

options.text: A single channel TCAS computer. CORRECT
Two TCAS antennas. Correct
Two mode S ATC transponders, one active the other in standby.   CORRECT
an ATC /TCAS control pane  CORRECT

67aoh.question: Some TCAS advisories are inhibited depending on the aircraft altitude.

hez0o.question: Following messages can be displayed to draw pilot's attention: • TCAS: REDUCE RANGE displayed when a TA or RA is detected and ND range above 40 NM. • TCAS : CHANGE MODE displayed when a TA or RA is detected and ND mode is PLAN.

6nr08.question: The ADIRS includes ____ ADMs (Air Data Modules) which convert pneumatic data from PITOT and STAT probes into numerical data for the ADIRUs.

options.text: Four
Six
) Eight
Two

1k8pu.question: When radar is operating it can display the weather image on the ND in any mode except?

options.text: PLAN
ARC
ROSE NAv
ROSE VOR

06eyol.question: On the weather radar control panel, there is the GCS switch. what does GCS stand for?

options.text: Ground Clutter Suppressio
Gross Cloud Switch
Gross Cloud Storm
Ground Clear Safety

ireka.question: RADIO ALTIMETERS: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The aircraft has two radio altimeters. Normally CAPTs PFD displays RA 1 height, and the F/Os PFD displays RA 2 height
The aircraft has three radio altimeters. Normally CAPTs PFD displays RA 1 height, F/Os PFD displays RA 2 height and RA 3 is on standby
The aircraft has two radio altimeters. Normally CAPTs PFD displays RA 2 height and F/Os PFD displays RA 1 height
The aircraft has three radio altimeters. Normally CAPTs PFD displays RA 2 height, F/Os PFD displays RA 1 height and RA 3 is on standby

4rp1kj.question: A fast IRS alignment must be performed when the deviation of the IRS position from the FMGC position is at or above ___ NM

t0s9t.question: What is the maximum difference between altitude indications of ADR 1 and ADR 2 on the ground?

options.text: 15 ft
25 ft
30 ft

txp53.question: From which height (AGL) can you expect RA altitude callouts as earliest during approach?

dv307.question: The GPWS generates aural and visual warnings up to ____ radio altitude?

bzl0df.question: In case of double FMGC failure, can you still tune navaids?

options.text: Yes, by MCDU 1
Yes, by MCDU 2
Yes, by RMPs
Tuning is not possible anymore

3zzze.question: A complete IRS alignment must be performed in the following cases:

options.text: Before the first flight of the day and there is a crew change
All answers are correct
When the GPS is not available and the expected flight time is more than 3 h
When the GPS is not available and the NAVAIDS coverage is poor on the expected route

99q68.question: 6 How and when is a Resolution Advisory (RA) displayed by the TCAS on the ND?

options.text: Red square. TAU about 25 seconds from your aircraft (TAU depending on aircraft altitude and relative altitude of intruder)
Amber square. TAU about 25 seconds from your aircraft (TAU depending on aircraft altitude and relative altitude of intruder)
Red square. TAU about 45 seconds from your aircraft (TAU depending on aircraft altitude and relative altitude of intruder)
White square. TAU about 45 seconds from your aircraft (TAU depending on aircraft altitude and relative altitude of intruder)

f0x94.question: WEATHER RADAR: Mode select switch set to WX+T. Within which distance can turbulence areas be displayed (displayed in magenta)?

options.text: 10 NM
100 NM
40 NM
200 NM

ozwnq.question: The aircraft has two ILS receivers. Where is ILS 1 information displayed?

options.text: PFD 1 and ND 1 display ILS 1 information
PFD 2 and ND 2 display ILS 1 information
PFD 2 and ND 1 display ILS 1 information
PFD 1 and ND 2 display ILS 1 information

zhnif.question: 9 FMGS INITIALIZATION: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: All answers are correct

Do not cycle the navigation data base while airborne because doing so will delete the flight plan, eliminate all speed predictions, and blank the ND. If the aircraft is in managed speed, Green Dot becomes the speed target
When a NAVAID is deselected, it is not more used for navigation by the FMGC during the rest of the flight
A deselected NAVAID can still be manually tuned on the RAD NAV page and displayed on ND

c42kp.question: What might be the reason for the PFD to not display V2 although it has been inserted in the FMS?

options.text: A DU failure
The PFD is not in managed mode
The Doors are still open
Both FDs are off

a533n.question: FMGS DATA INSERTION: Which statement is correct?

options.text: By presetting a HDG or TRK before takeoff disarms the navigation mode and allows the runway mode to remain engaged after takeoff
All answers are correct
When a heading has been preset before takeoff or go-around, the direction of the turn will be such as to cause the shortest turn at the moment of engagement
After takeoff the pilot can cancel the heading preset by pushing the HDG/TRK knob back in again

q17j7.question: During operation on contaminated runways and taxiways: Which statement is correct?

options.text: The radio altimeters are never affected in their operation
The radio altimeters are not affected by compacted snow
The radio altimeters are only affected by ice on apron, taxiways or runways due to reflection characteristics of the surface
On contaminated aprons, taxiways or runways, the radio altimeter indications may fluctuate

hasn2.question: The FLIGHT INSTRUMENT TOLERANCES apply to aircraft in:

options.text: In climb, cruise and descent phases in clean configuration only
In Symmetrical flight (no sideslip), in straight flight (no ban angle), in clean configuration and at constant speed
In any phase of the flight and in any configuration (Tables are compensated trough testflights)
Any phase of the flight in clean configuration and in straight flight (Tables are compensated trough testflights)

x3hgy.question: In which of the following cases must the flight crew confirm the correct tuning of the desired station via the audio system?

options.text: In the vicinity of thunderstorm activity or at night along a coast line
if only one EIS is operative
When one ND is inoperative
A Station has either been autotuned or tuned manually by a crew member's entering the associated ident on the MCDU RAD NAV page, and ident appearing on the ND is the wrong one

zxyoe.question: Can a TCAS RA, during the same evasive manoeuvre, order a climbing avoidance action, immediately followed by a descending corrective action?

options.text: No, the system is not capable of such complex reactive calculations
No, once an evasive manoeuvre has been initiated, it has to be completed in the same vertical direction of flight and only the vertical speed order value is increased
Yes, it is a Modified Corrective Advisory triggered if the intruder's vertical speed has changed
Yes, but only if the order is given by the air traffic controller

hlzns.question: During a preventive RA the pilot flying must keep the aircraft vertical speed:

options.text: In the red area of the rectangular speed scale
In the recommended green vertical speed range only
In the recommended green vertical speed range, or in the grey vertical speed range without the risk of conflict (preventive RA)
Outside the amber vertical speed range

h3ipv.question: On the A320 in order to prevent an erroneous data initialization, wait at least ... min after power-up and then select the ADIRS selector to NAV

options.text: No time defined for A320

liqdh.question: The following Radio-Nav tuning modes are available:

options.text: Automatic Tuning only
Automatic and Manual Tuning only
Automatic and Back Up Tuning only
Automatic, Manual and Back Up Tuning

j8lpsi.question: Altimeter check after passing the transition altitude: The PM announces „passing FL 60 now“. What do you check?

options.text: Nothing
If the altimeter readings are within +/- 50ft
) If the gear is up
If the altimeter readings are within 100ft

cey4o.question: PREDICTIVE WINDSHEAR: During the takeoff roll, up to 100 kt, both warnings and cautions are available within a range of ___ NM.

options.text: 1 NM
2 NM
3 NM
5 NM

gjhh1.question: GPWS: In case of low accuracy of the aircraft position computed by FMGC, the predictive functions of GPWS ____.

options.text: Must manually be deactivated
Are automatically deactivated
Must manually be activated
Are automatically activated

lwl4y.question: The Ground Proximity Warning System (GPWS) generates aural and visual warnings, when one of the following conditions occurs.

options.text: Excessive rate of descent, Altitude loss after takeoff or go-around
Excessive terrain closure rate, Unsafe terrain clearance when not in landing configuration
Too far below glideslope
All answers are correct

73aqsj.question: During IR alignment on MCDU INIT page an ALIGN IRS prompt appears. What is your action?

options.text: ) Switch off all ADIRS selector and start alignment again
Press the ALIGN IRS prompt to sent MCDU INIT page coordinates to the ADIRS
One ADIRS has failed. Switch the affected ADIRS selector off and on and start alignment again
There is an internal failure in the satellite distribution and correcting system. Call NASA hotline for satellite relaunch

ydx8m.question: When the Mode Sel of the TCAS is set to TA/RA:

options.text: All RAs are converted into TAs. Tas, proximate and intruders are displayed if the ALT RPTG switch is ON and the transponder is not on STBY
The RAs, TAs and proximate intruders are displayed if the ALT RPTG switch is ON and the transponder is not on STBY
The RAs, TAs and proximate intruders are displayed if the ALT RPTG switch is ON and the other aircrafts are on the same ATC Frequency
The TCAS system is automatically in standby until 50 ft RA after takeoff

3vxj6.question: Does turning OFF the ADR pb switch also turn OFF the IR?

options.text: No
Only partially
Yes
Only if the IR is running faulty

1872f.question: The Air Data and Inertial Reference System (ADIRS) supplies temperature, anemometric, barometric and inertial parameters to the EFIS system (PFD and ND) and to other user systems (FMGC , FADEC, ELAC, SEC, FAC, FWC, SFCC, ATC, GPWS, CFDIU, CPC).

egl5u.question: The ADIRU is supplied by: ADIRU 1: CAPT probes / ADIRU 2: F/O probes / ADIRU 3: STBY probes and CAPT TAT.

oy689.question: During normal operation, the GPS receiver 1 supplies _____, and the GPS receiver 2 supplies ____.

options.text: ADIRU 1 and ADIRU 2 / ADIRU 3
ADIRU 1 and ADIRU 3 / ADIRU 2
ADIRU 1 / ADIRU 2 and ADIRU 3
ADIRU 1 / ADIRU 2

2nvv8.question: GPS/ADIRU operation: In order to keep side 1 and side 2 segregation, in case ADIRU 2 fails, the ATT HDG selector has to be selected to:

options.text: CAPT 3 so that ADIRU 3 will be supplied with MMR 2 data.
) F/O 3 so that ADIRU 3 will be supplied with MMR 1 data
) F/O 3 so that ADIRU 3 will be supplied with MMR 2 data.
CAPT 3 so that ADIRU 3 will be supplied with MMR 1 data

tjii7.question: In normal operation, the FMGC tunes navaids automatically, with each FMGC controlling its own receivers.

co0dvj.question: The aircraft has two DMEs. The frequency set automatically on the DME corresponds to the frequency/channel that set on the ____.

options.text: VOR only
ILS only
VOR or ILS or FIX INFO
VOR or ILS only

qqq4g.question: The NAV key (transparent switchguard) engages the radio navigation backup mode. It takes control of the VOR, ILS, MLS, and ADF receivers away from the FMGC and gives it to the RMP.

vm088.question: Normally the CAPT PFD displays the RA1 height and the F/O PFD displays the RA2 height. If one RA fails:

options.text: The RA for the serviceable side is displayed only and on the failed side two amber crosses are displayed
Both PFDs display the height from the remaining one.Both PFDs display the height from the remaining RA
RA readout is lost and can not be recoverd
The AIR DATA rotary selector on the SWITCHING PANEL must be selected accordingly to recover the RA indication on the failed PFD side

7395bl.question: Regarding RA, if time between two consecutive predetermined call outs exceeds a certain threshold, the present height is repeated at regular intervals. The threshold is:

options.text: 20 seconds above 50 feet and 10 seconds below 50 feet
11 seconds above 50 feet and 4 seconds below 50 feet
The threshold is 11 seconds regardsless of the RA
The threshold is 4 seconds regardsless of the RA

niz26.question: The loudspeaker announces RETARD at ____ or at ____ if autothrust is active and one autopilot is in LAND mode.

options.text: 10 ft or at 5 ft
30 ft or at 15 ft
20 ft or at 10 ft
50 ft or at 10 f

v57dz.question: The aircraft has ____ ATC transponders which are controlled by a dual control box on the center pedestal.

options.text: One
Two
Three
Four

fsgjo.question: The weather radars has a Predictive WindShear system (PWS) that operates when the PWS switch is in the AUTO position, _____

options.text: And the aircraft radio height is below 2.300 feet, and the Weather radar is on
And the aircraft radio height is below 2.300 feet, and the Weather radar is OFF and at least one engine is running and ground speed is greater than 30 kt
And the aircraft radio height is below 2.300 feet, and the Weather radar is OFF, and Aircraft longitudinal acceleration is above a given threshold during at least 0.5s
All answers are correct

xfhig.question: At Approach and Landing, the predictive windshear warning (more than one answer is correct)

options.text: alerts are inhibited below 50 feet. CORRECT+1
During final apporach, the visual and aural warning alerts are downgraded to caution alerts between 370 feet AGL and 50 feet AGL, and range between 1.5 NM and 0.5 NM
alerts are inhibited above 100 knots and up to 50 feet
For traffic intruders in the departure and arrival sector
The airspace, within a range of 5 NM ahead of the aircraft, for windshears
The airspace, within a range of 15 NM ahead of the aircraft, for windshears
The airspace, within a range of 10 NM ahead of the aircraft, for windshears

pafrv.question: The Ground Proximity Warning System (GPWS) generates aural and visual warnings, when one of warning conditions occurs between ______.

options.text: Between radio heights 50 ft and 3.000 feet
Between barometric altitudes 50 ft and 2.450 ft
Between radio heights 10 ft and 2.450 ft
Between barometric altitudes 50 ft and 3.000 ft

giy4j.question: 1 The TCAS detection capability is limited to intruders flying within a maximum range of ____

options.text: 40 NM
80 NM
100 NM
160 NM

78n4e.question: The TCAS (Traffic alert and Collision Avoidance System): (more than one answer is correct)

options.text: Detects any aircraft, equipped with transponders, flying in its vicinity. CORRECT
Displays potential and predicted collision targets. CORRECT
Issues vertical orders to avoid conflict. CORRECT

2mj9g.question: The TCAS interrogates transponder of intruders. From the transponder replies, the TCAS determines __________ for each intruder:

options.text: its relative bearing.
its range and closure rate.
ts relative altitude if available (ATC mode C or S).
its groundspeed

2mj9g.explanation: FIXME: this question needs to be fixed. All answers are correct. Please Open a PR

bkx9b.question: With the TRAFFIC selector on the ATC/TCAS Panel in the THRT position:

options.text: Proximate and other intruders are displayed only if a TA only is present, and they are within 2.300 ft above and 2.300 ft below the aircraft
roximate intruders only are displayed even if a TA or RA or STBY is set, and they are within 2.700 ft above and 2.700 ft below the aircraft
Other intruders only are displayed even if a TA or RA or STBY is set, and they are within 3.000 ft above and 3.000 ft below the aircraft
Proximate and other intruders are displayed only if a TA or RA is present, and they are within 2.700 ft above and 2.700 ft below the aircraft

lvdu9.question: The TCAS vertical speed arrow Displayed only if the intruder ____.

options.text: V/S > 250 ft/min
V/S > 500 ft/min
V/S > 750 ft/m
V/S > 1000 ft/min

upt8y.question: TCAS ND Indications: A ____ white range ring is displayed when a 10 NM or 20 NM range is selected

options.text: 2.5 NM
5.0 NM
7.5 NM
10 NM

syyv4.question: The ADIRU gives true heading instead of magnetic heading: above 80° North; above 75° North between 90° and 120° West (magnetic polar region); and above 60° South

e9b1c.question: The ATT HDG and AIR DATA selector operates as follows: NORM: ADIRU 1 supplies data to PFD 1, ND 1, RMI and VOR/DME. ADIRU 2 supplies data to PFD 2, and ND2. CAPT 3 : ADR 3 or IR 3 replaces ADR 1 or IR 1. F/0 3 : ADR 3 or IR 3 replaces ADR 2 or IR 2
